section.description: You can change the background CSS when a field has an error by naming a new CSS class in this property. You can then define the CSS class in the [Local CSS definitions] property in the [CSS/SVG] section of the UX Properties page.

section.title: Create a Component with Validation Errors
Assign a New CSS Class for 'Field with error'

step.description: On the UX Properties page go to the Validation and Error Reporting section. Click the 'Error style' property's dropdown and select 'Block'.
Click the row expander next to the 'Error style' property.
Next to the 'Classname - field with error' property type the name of a new CSS class that you wish to define, for example 'fieldError'.
Scroll down the UX Properties page to the CSS/SVG section. Click the [...] button next to the 'Local CSS definitions' property.
At the bottom of the CSS Editor click on the 'Code' tab.
In the 'Code' tab type the name of the CSS class you defined, in this case 'fieldError'. To define it as a CSS class place a period '.' in front of it and a pair of curly brackets after it {}
At the bottom of the CSS Editor click to open the 'Design' tab.

Highlight the CSS class you defined in the list on the left. Alter the classes CSS properties using the 'Property' settings on the left. Adjust the 'Background', 'Color','Font Family','Border', and 'Padding' settings. Click OK.
Run the component in Live Preview. Generate an error message. The field with the error in it should take on the CSS class you defined.
